pros: I am part of a small team and is great, with total uniderstanding that life is not only work, but that there should be work life balance.
cons: Seems that payment is in the lower side because is a non for profit. We have salary packaging benefits, but is not clear how to use them.

review_title: Low pay for experience, qualification and workload
pros: Lovely colleagues, high-quality hardware and the office has been refurbished to look and feel premium
cons: Inadequate support from middle and higher level management. No performance reviews or pay negotiations at all (there is no policy for this for OD staff). Expected to act in higher roles with no pay. More focus from C-suite and director level on presenting a good image and meetings to pat each other on the back than actually doing meaningful work. Zero effort into retaining great staff who have lots of passion, happy to let them burn out and resign. The most toxic workplace i've encountered.

pros: Good location Nice office Good values
cons: Focus of organisation is on research and specialist programs. Treatment of primary services are misaligned with how they treat tertiary services

review_title: Good environment to get some experience
pros: Good work life balance Good perks
cons: Contract based employment, low job security except for upper management

pros: Progressive and energetic company to work for
cons: Low pay and little career options

pros: Balance between work and private life

review_title: Poor management lets down excellent staff
pros: Has many first-rate researchers, who are dedicated to improving youth mental health.
cons: Many of the staff are demoralised because of the management style. The CEO is narcissistic, does not support the development of other staff and does not devolve decision making. There is too much use of seagull management and throwing money at problems.
